TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Outline extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Defines a simple shape, used for bounding graphical regions.

remarks.para: Defines a simple shape, used for bounding graphical regions.
Can be computed for a View, or computed by a Drawable, to drive the shape of shadows cast by a View, or to clip the contents of the View.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

remarks.para: Constructs an empty Outline. Call one of the setter methods to make the outline valid for use with a View.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Alpha : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns the alpha represented by the Outline. -or- Sets the alpha represented by the Outline - the degree to which the producer is guaranteed to be opaque over the Outline's shape.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Returns the alpha represented by the Outline.
Property setter documentation:
Sets the alpha represented by the Outline - the degree to which the producer is guaranteed to be opaque over the Outline's shape.
An alpha value of 0.0f either represents completely transparent content, or content that isn't guaranteed to fill the shape it publishes.
Content producing a fully opaque (alpha = 1.0f) outline is assumed by the drawing system to fully cover content beneath it, meaning content beneath may be optimized away.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool CanClip() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns whether the outline can be used to clip a View.

remarks.para: Returns whether the outline can be used to clip a View.
As of API 33, all Outline shapes support clipping. Prior to API 33, only Outlines that could be represented as a rectangle, circle, or round rect supported clipping.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool GetRect(class Android.Graphics.Rect outRect) cil managed

Docs.param: the rect to populate with the outline bounds, if set
Docs.summary: Populates outBounds with the outline bounds, if set, and returns true.
Docs.returns: true if outBounds was populated with outline bounds, or false if no outline bounds are set

remarks.para: Populates outBounds with the outline bounds, if set, and returns true. If no outline bounds are set, or if a path has been set via #setPath(Path), returns false.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns whether the Outline is empty.

remarks.para: Returns whether the Outline is empty.
Outlines are empty when constructed, or if #setEmpty() is called, until a setter method is called

MemberSignature.Value: public void Offset (int dx, int dy);
.method public hidebysig instance void Offset(int32 dx, int32 dy) cil managed

Docs.summary: Offsets the Outline by (dx,dy).

remarks.para: Offsets the Outline by (dx,dy). Offsetting is cumulative, so additional calls to offset() will add to previous offset values. Offset only applies to the current geometry (setRect(), setPath(), etc.); setting new geometry resets any existing offset.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the rounded rect radius, if set, or a value less than 0 if a path has been set via #setPath(Path).
Docs.value: the rounded rect radius, or value < 0

remarks.para: Returns the rounded rect radius, if set, or a value less than 0 if a path has been set via #setPath(Path). A return value of 0 indicates a non-rounded rect.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetConvexPath(class Android.Graphics.Path convexPath) cil managed

Docs.param: used to construct the Outline. As of android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#Q, it is no longer required to be convex.
Docs.summary: Sets the Outline to a android.graphics.Path#isConvex() convex path.

remarks.para: Sets the Outline to a android.graphics.Path#isConvex() convex path.

This member is deprecated. As of android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#Q, the restriction that the path must be convex is removed. However, the API is misnamed until android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#R, when #setPath is introduced. Use #setPath instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Sets the Outline to the rounded rect defined by the input coordinates and corner radius.

remarks.para: Sets the Outline to the rounded rect defined by the input coordinates and corner radius.
Passing a zero radius is equivalent to calling #setRect(int, int, int, int)
